types.name: Root_Type_for_ParcelAttributes_Input
types.description:
Represents a parcel attached to an order.

## parcels vs products
How parcels relate to products is controlled by whether or not a **`product_attributes`** key is also defined. If a **`product_attributes`** is not defined, then the number of cartons is determined by the `Settings -> Pick & Pack -> Allocate each item in an order to a separate carton` option in Shippit, and the **`qty`** field will now specify either the number of parcels or products.

If a **`product_attributes`** key is specified in the request, then the products can be specified separately from the parcels. In which case, the **`qty`** field should not be present: each parcel attributes object represents a separate parcel, and the number of products is specified in the **`product_attributes`** key. There is a maximum of 1000 parcels per request.

inputFields.name: dangerous_goods_class
inputFields.description: This is the DG class when making dangerous goods declarations.

inputFields.name: dangerous_goods_code
inputFields.description:
This is the DG code required when making dangerous goods declarations.

Before you can declare orders as having dangerous goods, you must first request for dangerous goods to enabled for your account. Contact Shippit Support or your account manager to have this enabled.

DG surcharges are often charged on the weight of the order, so it is recommended to split your order into multiple orders if your order contains either:
- both dangerous and non-dangerous goods, or
- more than one dangerous goods code

inputFields.name: dangerous_goods_text
inputFields.description: Additional information related to dangerous goods being shipped

inputFields.name: depth
inputFields.description: Depth of the parcel in metres

inputFields.name: label_number
inputFields.description:
Parcel number in the carrier system.

This is used when the order is a tracking order, to match the parcel number in a carrier against the parcel recorded in shippit.

inputFields.name: length
inputFields.description: Length of the parcel in metres

inputFields.name: location
inputFields.description: Location of the product

inputFields.name: origin_country_code
inputFields.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2) for the product's origin country. This is used in customs tracking for International shipments. Defaults to the home country of the Merchant.

inputFields.name: packed
inputFields.description:
The number of products packed; used in partial orders, or otherwise when the number of products in the parcel is less than the total in the order. If not present, set to product `quantity`.

If this is present, at least 1 item should have packed greater than `0`.

For international orders, all items should have packed greater than `0`.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: Unit price of each product line item. Used in the packing slip and customs declarations.

inputFields.name: product_line_id
inputFields.description: Product line associated with product. Like SKU, this is also for stock keeping purposes, and can be used when SKU would not be enough (e.g. an order containing multiple lines with the same SKU)

inputFields.name: qty
inputFields.description:
```conditional``` -- The number of products specified by the entry.

There is a maximum of 1000 parcels per quote request.

Should not be present if a `product_attributes` key is present in the request.

If `Allocate each item in an order to a separate carton` is enabled in Shippit, a separate parcel is generated for each product listed.

inputFields.name: sku
inputFields.description: ```conditional``` -- Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) code of the product, for stock keeping purposes. Mandatory on international orders with specific couriers.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: ```conditional``` -- Title or description of the product. Mandatory for international orders with specific couriers.

inputFields.name: weight
inputFields.description: Weight of the parcel in kilos.

inputFields.name: width
inputFields.description: Width of the parcel in metres.

types.name: Root_Type_for_ReturnRequestItem
types.description: The root of the ReturnRequestItem type's schema.

fields.name: api_reference
fields.description: The ID of the item, each item ID must be unique to the order.

fields.name: depth
fields.description: The item's depth measurement, in centimeteres

fields.name: discount_amount
fields.description: The discount amount applicable to the item. Note: Only item level discounts are considered here. Subtotal & Order level discounts are not considered in this response value.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the item record in Shippit Connect

fields.name: image_url
fields.description: The URL of the product image

fields.name: is_price_incl_tax
fields.description: Indicates whether the price fields (`original_price`, `price`) includes tax as part of it's value.

fields.name: is_virtual
fields.description:
Indicates whether the item is considered as a "virtual" item.

Virtual items are considered non-phyiscal items that do not equire shipping. ie: Virtual Gift Cards and Downloadable Content.

fields.name: length
fields.description: The item's length measurement, in centimeteres

fields.name: name
fields.description: The item's name

fields.name: non_return_reason
fields.description: The reason why the item cannot be returned.

fields.name: options
fields.description: An array of options applicable to the item (ie: colour or size)

fields.name: original_price
fields.description:
The original price of the item, before any discounts.

Note: Some integration platforms do not support providing data relating to the original price of the item at the time the order was placed. In these instances, a `NULL` value is returned.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The item's price, after any item-level discounts applied

fields.name: qty
fields.description:
The qty of the item that could be returned by the customer.

This value takes into consideration all avaiable data from the Integration Platform as to the "returnable amount".

In all instances, Connect will attempt to determine a suitable amount that is available for return, considering both the qty that was originally ordered, qty shipped to the customer, along with taking into consideration any existing returns, refunds or cancellations.

fields.name: qty_cancelled
fields.description:
The qty of the item that has been cancelled, according to the Integration Platform.

A cancelled item is considered as an item that was ordered, but not yet paid for by the customer.

Note: Not all platforms support the cancellation of an item. In cases where this data is not available, a value of `NULL` will be returned.

fields.name: qty_invoiced
fields.description: The qty of the item that has been invoiced, according to the Integration Platform

fields.name: qty_ordered
fields.description: The qty of the item that was originally ordered, according to the Integration Platform

fields.name: qty_refunded
fields.description:
The qty of the item that has been refunded, according to the Integration Platform.

A refunded item is considered as an item that was ordered and invoiced to the customer.

Note: Not all platforms support the refund of an item. In cases where this data is not available, a value of `NULL` will be returned.

fields.name: qty_returned
fields.description:
The qty of the item returned, according to the integration platform.

A return item is considered as an item that was shipped to the customer and returned baack to the merchant.

Note: Not all platforms support the return of an item. In cases where this data is not available, a value of `NULL` will be returned.

fields.name: qty_shipped
fields.description: The qty of the item that has been marked as shipped according to the Integration Platform

fields.name: sku
fields.description: The item's stock keeping unit (Item SKU)

fields.name: tax
fields.description: The tax amount applicable to the item

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The item's weight measurement, in kilograms

fields.name: width
fields.description: The item's width measurement, in centimeteres

types.name: Root_Type_for_quote_Input
types.description: A specification of the queries to include in the quote.

inputFields.name: authority_to_leave
inputFields.description: If set to "Yes", the system returns all quotes where Authority to Leave is enabled.

inputFields.name: dropoff_address
inputFields.description: The dropoff address for the quote. Mandatory for `OnDemand` orders.

inputFields.name: dropoff_at
inputFields.description: The start of the dropoff window for `OnDemand` orders in the format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss+HH:mm`

inputFields.name: dropoff_country_code
inputFields.description: The destination country code for the quote in `ISO 3166 Alpha-2` format. If unassigned, defaults to the country code of the merchant's primary location, or otherwise 'AU'

inputFields.name: dropoff_deadline_at
inputFields.description: The end of the dropoff window for `OnDemand` orders in the format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss+HH:mm`

inputFields.name: dropoff_postcode
inputFields.description: destination postcode for the quote

inputFields.name: dropoff_state
inputFields.description: destination state for the quote. **Required** when `dropoff_postcode` is unassigned or set to `AU`

inputFields.name: dropoff_suburb
inputFields.description: The dropoff suburb

inputFields.name: dutiable_amount
inputFields.description:
```conditional``` Declared value for customs when shipping international.

Mandatory for International orders.

inputFields.name: features
inputFields.description:
Some carriers provide add-on services (features) which can be indicated when requesting a quote. These services are identified by a unique string and will depend on the carrier. To request these services, add a string to these field.
Services supported at the moment:
- `white_glove` (`Neway`, `DesignerTransport`):
      A delivery service that offers more personalised and tailored services for shipping high value, large or fragile goods.
- `calculate_ddp` (`SmartRoutingInternational`):
      When requested, the returned quote prices are inclusive of import taxes, duties and fees.

inputFields.name: order_date
inputFields.description: delivery date for the order, required for `priority` orders

inputFields.name: parcel_attributes
inputFields.description:
An array of parcel specifications to be included in the quote.

Each item can be used to specify the qty, dimensions, and other information about the products to be shipped, and the parcel used to ship it.

At minimum, only the `qty` and `weight` fields are required. There is a maximum of 1000 parcels per quote request.

inputFields.name: pickup_at
inputFields.description:
In order to fulfill the delivery commitment made to the customer, the carrier needs to know the pickup and delivery times for the parcel(s). Below, you will find all the fields that the carrier may require. The specific fields that are mandatory will depend on the carrier and the requested service.

The start of the pickup window for `OnDemand` orders in the format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss+HH:mm`

inputFields.name: pickup_deadline_at
inputFields.description: The end of the pickup window for `OnDemand` orders in the format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss+HH:mm`

inputFields.name: product_attributes
inputFields.description: An array of product details to be included in the quote

inputFields.name: product_currency
inputFields.description: Three letter ISO 4217 currency code that applies to the products which will be used for customs.

inputFields.name: return_all_quotes
inputFields.description: If set to `true`, the system returns all quotes instead of cheapest/fastest quote. Defaults to false.

inputFields.name: service_levels
inputFields.description:
An array of service leves to return quotes for. Valid values include:
- `standard`
- `express`
- `priorty`
- `on_demand`

Represents a response to the Tracking API, which provides tracking info for a specific order.

An event that tracks a change in `status` of a parcel's journey to fulfillment, with a `timestamp` of when the event happened.

This can be either be provided by the merchant as part of a **tracking order** request, or returned by a **track** request.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: mutationInput_createOrder_input_order_customs_clearance_attributes_export_reason
types.description:
A term used to indicate the reason for export of dutiable goods. Selected options can affect how your shipment is cleared and how much tax is imposed on your shipment during customs clearance. Example values:
- `Permanent`
- `Temporary`
- `Return For Repair`
- `Used Exhibition Goods To Origin`
- `Intercompany Use`
- `Commercial Purpose Or Sale`
- `Personal Belongings or Personal Use`
- `Sample`
- `Gift`
- `Return To Origin`
- `Warranty Replacement`
- `Diplomatic Goods`
- `Defence Material`

types.name: mutationInput_createOrder_input_order_customs_clearance_attributes_incoterm
types.description:
A universal term of trade that defines the responsibility and obligations with the transport of goods.  Most commonly used to indicate the responsible party for payment of duties and taxes.  Valid values include:
- `DDU`
- `DDP`
- `EXW`
- `FCA`
- `CPT`
- `CFR`
- `CIP`
- `CIF`
- `DAF`
- `DAT`
- `DAP`
- `DPU`
- `DES`
- `DEQ`
- `FAS`
- `FOB`

types.name: mutationInput_createOrder_input_order_customs_clearance_attributes_recipient_id
types.description: A free text field to provide a identification number for a recipient. For example, a citizen identification number or passport number which is required for customs clearance for some international destinations. eg: PA1992991

types.name: mutationInput_createOrder_input_order_customs_clearance_attributes_tax_id_country_code
types.description: The issuing country of the tax id number in in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 format. eg. GB for Great Britain

types.name: mutationInput_createOrder_input_order_customs_clearance_attributes_tax_id_number
types.description: The tax id number that is declared against this order.

types.name: mutationInput_createOrder_input_order_customs_clearance_attributes_tax_id_type
types.description:
The Shippier's tax id type which is passed to a carrier for the purpose of customs clearance. Valid values include:
- `EORI`
- `IOSS`
- `LVG`
- `OSR`
- `VOEC`
- `VAT/GST`
- `FTZ`
- `DAN`
- `TAN`
- `DTF`
- `EIN`
- `SSN`
- `DUN`
- `FED`
- `STA`
- `CNP`
- `GBVAT`
- `NZ IRD`
